Statement from the Office of Congressman Sylvester Turner on His Passing https://t.co/rWnkDeMbZq

My message to the current administration for tonight’s State of the Union: “Don’t mess with Medicaid.”

I am proud to have Angela Hernandez here from our Congressional district as my guest. She is representing and advocating for her daughter Baislee Garcia who has a rare genetic disorder Chromosome 8p: Inversion/Duplication/Deletion. 

Let me be clear: any cuts to Medicaid are a direct attack on families like Angela’s. President Trump and Elon Musk’s push to gut Medicaid is nothing short of a betrayal of the most vulnerable among us. They are playing politics with children’s lives, and I will not stand for it.

I’m Angela Hernandez, and I’m honored to be Congressman Sylvester Turner’s guest for President Trump’s Joint Address to Congress.

I am here to advocate for essential Medicaid services for my two-year-old daughter, Baislee, who is bravely facing a rare genetic disorder. Her future depends on the support we can secure for families like ours.

Meet Angela Hernandez, my guest tonight at the Joint Address to Congress. She’s from the 18th district in Houston, Texas, and came to advocate for Medicaid services that are vital for her two-year-old daughter, Baislee, who has a rare genetic disorder. Medicaid covered the $23,000 medical bed that the family could not afford.

Medicaid provides over $16,000 per month in essential services and support to help Baislee develop and receive the care she needs. President Trump is already working to take these services away, directly attacking the health and well-being of children like Baislee. We will not stand by while he jeopardizes their lives. I will continue the fight for the Medicaid support that is crucial for families like Angela’s.

Pausing military aid to Ukraine is pure insanity. This move only empowers Putin, hurts our ally, and undermines our national security. Ukraine is literally fighting for its survival, and cutting off support now is a betrayal of their trust and a gift to Russia. https://t.co/APeGvMvqsN

Tonight, I spoke with @TheRevAl about how President Trump has failed hardworking Americans by ignoring inflation and rising grocery prices. His administration has been hostile to federal workers, rolled back DEI initiatives, and prioritized tax breaks for the wealthy. 

We deserve better from our President and the Republicans. #PoliticsNation
I am live on @MSNBC’s @TheRevAl Sharpton show now. Tune in. https://t.co/Jdt9kyZdeG

The sacrifices our veterans make in service to our country clearly do not matter to President Trump or billionaire Elon Musk. Firing nearly 6,000 veterans is unjustifiable.  

Houston has the second-largest veteran population in the country, with over 300,000 veterans. In TX-18, there are 25,148 veterans. These men and women have given everything to defend our freedoms, and now they are being cast aside.

The meeting today between President Trump and President Zelenskyy in the Oval Office was unprecedented and embarrassing. America is the most powerful nation in the world. The world looks to us as a leader.

The President and Vice President’s actions were not a good reflection of who we are as a country. What was said, and the tone in which it was delivered, did not advance America’s interests on the global stage. Today was not good diplomacy. It was shameful. President Trump is trying to force Ukraine to bow to Russia and Putin. Who would have thought we would be in this place?

Last week, I reintroduced the Due Process Continuity of Care Act, a bipartisan bill ensuring individuals in pretrial detention retain Medicaid access, addressing unjust gaps in healthcare coverage and reducing burdens on local governments. https://t.co/f2FmpyCYIc

I appreciate the EPA’s commitment to protecting the health and safety of our residents in Fifth Ward and Kashmere Gardens. 

The community meeting being held today, February 27, 2025, is an important opportunity to provide updates on the progress of the site cleanup, upcoming activities, and the results of soil sampling in schools, parks, and recreational areas.

On the floor this week, I spoke about a federal scientist fired by President Trump and Elon Musk. He said, “I have a PhD in biomedical engineering... Please protect these agencies.” 

In my district, the University of Houston faces frozen grants, creating uncertainty in cancer research. Firing cancer scientists is short-sighted and irresponsible.

House Republicans have just passed a budget that cuts nearly $1 trillion from Medicaid, leaving millions without access to healthcare. At the same time, it gives huge tax breaks to billionaires and large corporations. 

This is a clear choice to put the wealthiest Americans ahead of working families.

My Democratic colleagues and I oppose the Republican budget proposal endorsed by Donald Trump. This plan cuts Medicaid, undermines veterans’ benefits, and takes food from children and seniors, all to give tax breaks to billionaires and corporations. https://t.co/KpYmobdkFQ

I was proud to stand with my Democratic colleagues today to say NO to any Republican attempts to pass a budget that slashes Medicaid.

Protecting Americans and their healthcare shouldn’t be a political game. https://t.co/8omJly28K7

Today, I joined my Democratic colleagues in sending a letter to agency heads about the OPM email sent on February 22, 2025, linked to Elon Musk’s claim that federal workers must respond to his question, “What did you do last week?” or face resignation.

Musk’s threat caused unnecessary confusion. After backlash, OPM clarified that responses are voluntary and nonresponse does not equal resignation.

Federal employees must know that their jobs are secure and that we stand with them against any intimidation.

FYI: I’m voting NO on any budget that seeks to gut Medicaid this week, alongside my Democratic colleagues. The House Republicans’ plan would slash healthcare for millions, raise costs for families, and provide massive tax breaks to Trump’s billionaire allies.

I’m standing up for the people of TX-18 and fighting to protect your healthcare.

This week, I had the incredible honor of recognizing 14 exceptional students nominated to the U.S. Military Service Academies.

 It was a privilege to celebrate this achievement alongside their proud families! https://t.co/VjHPbBMci4

As this district week period comes to a close, I have worked to ensure the 18th Congressional District constituent's voices are heard. We held a town hall to listen to our resident's concerns.

I want them to know that as we begin our budget discussion, Republicans are doing everything they can to slash and cut essential services that we rely on every day including Medicaid and SNAP.

As I travel back to DC, I will continue to raise my voice, fight for our services, stand up to Elon Musk and the President, and address the concerns of our children, seniors, veterans, and all residents within the 18th Congressional District.

The fourth annual Diaspora Africa Conference took place at The Ion. 

This year’s event marked the second time it was held in Houston. 

Houston is home to a vibrant African community. The Nigerian community in our city is the largest in the country. 

Throughout my public service career, I have visited Africa many times and have truly enjoyed the relationships created through my many visits. 

I look forward to further building a stronger relationship as Congressman of the 18th Congressional District.

Seriously? We have to do better. Confirming Robert F. Kennedy Jr. as Health Secretary is a slap in the face to public health and safety. The guy has no experience and has spent years spreading dangerous misinformation about vaccines.  

This isn’t leadership, it’s a huge step backward for this country  and puts our children and families at risk.

Protecting taxpayer data shouldn’t be a partisan issue. It is the people’s right to security over their medical bills, Social Security, and taxpayer information. Congress must pass the Taxpayer Data Protection Act. 

This is our duty, not something to hand over to Elon Musk and his team.

This budget brought by House Republicans is nothing short of madness. It guts Medicaid, education, and healthcare to hand out $4.5 trillion in tax breaks for billionaires. It is a cruel and reckless attack on the very people Congress is supposed to serve. The plan slashes $1.5 trillion in spending over the next decade, with deep cuts to Medicaid that could strip patients of their benefits and force states to shoulder higher costs.

When it comes to addressing the everyday challenges Americans face, such as paying for rent, groceries, and gas, this budget proposal does nothing to prioritixe their needs. Instead, it places extreme policies above what truly matters.

Elon Musk, Trump’s top donor, now wields unchecked power with access to $6 trillion in Treasury funds, no hearings, no oversight. This is a blatant power grab, and Democrats won’t stay silent as Americans are robbed of their security.

President Trump’s tariffs are nothing more than a hidden tax on hardworking families who are already struggling to make ends meet. These tariffs, essentially a Trump Tax, will raise the cost of food, housing, gas, and cars, all of which are essentials that families depend on every single day. 

For example, the price of groceries like avocados and maple syrup will go up. Building a home or buying a car will become more expensive. Even gas prices could rise because these tariffs disrupt supply chains. Families trying to get by will feel the squeeze, and for what? These tariffs do not protect American workers; they punish American consumers. What happened to helping the American people? These tariffs do the opposite. 

They make it harder for families to put food on the table, keep a roof over their heads, and afford basic transportation. This Trump Tax is not what voters expected or deserved. President Trump and his Republican allies need to stop ripping off hardworking taxpayers. Families need relief, not higher prices on everything they rely on just to live.

The revelation that Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) has been granted access to sensitive Treasury systems is alarming and unacceptable. How was an unelected billionaire allowed to gain control of critical taxpayer data?

Social Security and Medicare systems are lifelines for millions of Americans, not tools for private interests or political agendas. This reckless decision jeopardizes the privacy and security of our citizens and undermines trust in our government.  

The American people deserve answers, accountability, and a government that prioritizes their interests, not the ambitions of the wealthy and powerful.

Statement from Congressman Sylvester Turner on the Federal Funding Freeze

The Trump administration’s federal funding freeze threatens critical resources for Texas’ 18th Congressional District, putting Houston families, students, small businesses, and veterans at risk. This reckless action jeopardizes funding for education, healthcare, disaster relief, and public safety—programs that are essential to our community.

In Houston, this freeze could leave families struggling to feed their children and pay for housing. Programs like Head Start and Title I grants, which provide vital support to local schools, would face devastating disruptions. Universities across Houston, especially our historically Black colleges and universities (HBCUs), could lose critical funding for education and job training.

Small businesses, many still recovering from past disasters, would lose access to loans and grants, while public safety funding for law enforcement and firefighters could be halted. Disaster relief from FEMA and healthcare funding for community health centers, life-saving medical research, and mental health services like the 988 Suicide Lifeline would also be at risk.

This unconstitutional freeze undermines Congress’ authority and creates unnecessary chaos for Houstonians who depend on these resources.

Today, I joined @CNN Newsroom's Jim Acosta to discuss the implementation of President Trump’s Immigration Executive Orders in Texas. I believe there is bipartisan support to secure the border and deport persons who have committed serious or violent crimes. 

At the same time, it is critical to protect law-abiding individuals who contribute so much to our society from being unjustly targeted in raids and deported. We have to give Dreamers the opportunity to stay and thrive in this country, which they call home.

The Tuskegee Airmen and Women Airforce Service Pilots broke barriers and made invaluable contributions to our military and our nation. Removing these videos diminishes their legacy and deprives service members of critical lessons in courage and perseverance. I urge President Trump to restore these materials to ensure their sacrifices are honored.

My Statement on President Trump’s First Week in Office:

“President Trump’s first week in office has set a dangerous course for our nation. From rolling back diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives to pardoning January 6th insurrectionists and enacting divisive immigration policies, these actions undermine core American values and threaten our democracy. 

The elimination of diversity programs in federal agencies and the return to outdated hiring practices jeopardize decades of progress toward fairness and equal opportunity. Diversity is not a threat—it is a cornerstone of America’s strength and unity. 

The pardons granted to January 6th insurrectionists send a deeply troubling message about accountability and justice. Similarly, President Trump’s challenge to the Constitution regarding the citizenship of American-born children of immigrants undermines the principles of equality and inclusion that define our nation. These actions threaten millions of families and weaken the foundation of what made this country great. 

The administration’s environmental actions, including withdrawing from the Paris Climate Agreement and dismantling critical protections, prioritize short-term profits over the long-term health of our planet and economy. These policies will harm working families and leave future generations to face the consequences. 

The American people deserve leaders who bring us together, uphold the rule of law, and work toward a future that benefits everyone.”

During my time as a public official, I have yet to miss the Black Heritage Society’s Dr. Martin Luther King Day Parade in Downtown Houston.

Although it was cold, I was welcomed to see Houstonians lined up along the streets and staying warm while each of us took a moment to remember the life and legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King.

Cecile Richards dedicated her life to ensuring the voices of women everywhere were heard. From leading Planned Parenthood to empowering grassroots movements, her legacy of courage and justice is woven into the fabric of Texas and beyond.  Rest in power, Cecile. Your light will continue to inspire us all.

Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. reminded us, "Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere." Today, we reflect on his unwavering dedication to civil rights and his dream of equality and justice for all. As we celebrate his legacy, let’s recommit to serving our communities and standing up against injustice. Together, we can make his dream a reality.

We are deeply saddened by the tragic loss of Deputy Jesus "Jesse" Vargas, who dedicated 17 years to serving the Brazoria County Sheriff's Office. Our thoughts and prayers are with his wife, children, and loved ones during this difficult time. Deputy Vargas’ commitment to his community will not be forgotten.

I look forward to serving #TX18 and ensuring Houston’s priorities are represented.
